title: createAction
contents:
mode_edit code
API > @ngrx/store

createActionlink

Creates a configured Creator function that, when called, returns an object in the shape of the Action interface.

See more...

createAction<T extends string, C extends Creator>(type: T, config?: C | { _as: "props"; }): ActionCreator<T>

Parameters

type T

Describes the action that will be dispatched
config C | { _as: "props"; }

Additional metadata needed for the handling of the action. See Usage Notes.

Optional. Default is undefined.

Returns

ActionCreator<T>

Descriptionlink

Action creators reduce the explicitness of class-based action creators.

Overloadslink

createAction(type: T): ActionCreator<T, () => Action<T>>

Parameters

type T

Returns

ActionCreator<T, () => Action<T>>
createAction(type: T, config: ActionCreatorProps<P> & NotAllowedCheck<P>): ActionCreator<T, (props: P & NotAllowedCheck<P>) => P & Action<T>>

Parameters

type T
config ActionCreatorProps<P> & NotAllowedCheck<P>

Returns

ActionCreator<T, (props: P & NotAllowedCheck<P>) => P & Action<T>>
createAction(type: T, creator: Creator<P, R & NotAllowedCheck<R>>): FunctionWithParametersType<P, R & Action<T>> & Action<T>

Parameters

type T
creator Creator<P, R & NotAllowedCheck<R>>

Returns

FunctionWithParametersType<P, R & Action<T>> & Action<T>

Usage noteslink

Declaring an action creator

Without additional metadata:

export const increment = createAction('[Counter] Increment');

With additional metadata:

export const loginSuccess = createAction( '[Auth/API] Login Success', props<{ user: User }>() );

With a function:

export const loginSuccess = createAction( '[Auth/API] Login Success', (response: Response) => response.user );

Dispatching an action

Without additional metadata:

store.dispatch(increment());

With additional metadata:

store.dispatch(loginSuccess({ user: newUser }));

Referencing an action in a reducer

Using a switch statement:

switch (action.type) { // ... case AuthApiActions.loginSuccess.type: { return { ...state, user: action.user }; } }

Using a reducer creator:

on(AuthApiActions.loginSuccess, (state, { user }) => ({ ...state, user }))

Referencing an action in an effect

effectName$ = createEffect( () => this.actions$.pipe( ofType(AuthApiActions.loginSuccess), // ... ) );
